data.title: Town of Fairfield, Connecticut
data.text:
Fairfield has three train stations on the Metro North rail line that extends from New Haven to New York's Grand Central Terminal. The Parking Authority of Fairfield manages the Fairfield Center Station and the Southport Station. Click on the individual station names below for additional information including directions and parking options.

Fairfield Center Station

Westbound (toward Manhattan)

165 Unquowa Road

Fairfield, CT 06824

Eastbound (toward New Haven)

333 Carter Henry Drive

Fairfield, CT 06824

Southport Station

Westbound (toward Manhattan)

400 Center Street

Southport, CT 06890

Eastbound (toward New Haven) - No Station House on this Side

96 Station Street

Southport, CT 06890

Fairfield Blackrock Station (formerly Fairfield Metro Station

61 Constant Comment Way

Fairfield, CT 06824

Rail Service

Metro North Railroad is the rail line that services Fairfield. Phone 800-638-7646. Web Site: www.mta.info.

Connecting Transportation

Bus: The Greater Bridgeport Transit Authority (203-333-3031) provides service to the center of Fairfield. Route schedules are listed at www.gogbt.com.

Amtrak: The closest Amtrak stop is Bridgeport. Amtrak connections are also available in New Haven and Stamford.
